intro: Nesaea hispidula, commonly known as the hairy nesaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which give it a delicate appearance. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Nesaea hispidula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in native plant gardens.
